intro: Dalechampia triphylla var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy three-leaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically clustered in cyathia, a type of cup-like structure common in the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
